RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 7F Dirt CR: 55. Maiden Claiming Purse 10800. FOR MAIDENS, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 121 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FOR HONOR AND LUCK took the lead and angled to the inside to show the way, came under pressure past the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn near the rail, drifted leaving the turn but dug in under steady stretch encouragement and held on. RUSH TO CANDY settled in the three path the first turn, started a bid nearing the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and was outfinished in the duel through the stretch. REMASTERED stalked off the rail the first turn, picked up the chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole and entered the far turn off the rail, drifted approaching the head of the lane then flattened inside the sixteenth pole. ROBBEDINTHEBAHAMAS stalked from the four path the first turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole but flattened in the three path on the far turn. WAVE ACTION rounded the first turn in the five path, left the turn outside and gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and showed little in the stretch. COMMANDER CODY saved ground on the opening turn, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole but weakened into the far turn.

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 7F Dirt CR: 70. Claiming Purse 11800. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since September 25 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: GET OFF MY CLOUD tapered in and stalked into the opening turn then took the nod into the backstretch and rated the pace, came under pressure toward the seven sixteenths pole, was met at the quarter and raced close at the rail through the far turn, recovered the edge passing the eighth pole and dug in determinedly to hold off the game challenge of MODERN DAY ROMANCE, who veered out leaving the gate and made contact with Curb That Tiger then rated close inside, bid approaching the five sixteenths pole, took the nod two deep passing the quarter pole, contested the edge through the turn, was met past the eighth pole, though, dueled gamely to the finish. AIR MEDAL raced off the rail on the first turn, picked up the chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole and rounded the far turn near the rail, eased out approaching the eighth pole and finished well to take third mid-stretch. MEETMARYSMAN was bumped leaving the gate then rounded the first turn about the four path, gave chase toward the three eighths pole, stayed in range of the lead in the four path on the far turn but flattened in the lane. SIENTE EL AMOR rated a slim lead inside on the first turn, was met into the backstretch and gave chase from that point but faded at the rail on the far turn. CURB THAT TIGER was bumped outward and into Meetmarysman leaving the gate and raced well off the pace about the three path the first turn, picked up the chase from the three eighths pole, raced in the four and five paths on the far turn and showed little further. WELL EQUIPPED rounded the first turn in the three path, gave chase toward the three eighths pole and raced in the four path on the far turn, lugged in past the eighth pole and weakened.

ENTRY.NAME: Air Medal
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

ENTRY.NAME: Siente El Amor
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated slim lead inside,met 1/2,chased,faded rail turn

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 87. Starter Optional Claiming Purse 19600. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $5,000 OR LESS SINCE OCTOBER 25, 2021 OR CLAIMING PRICE $10,000. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since September 25 Allowed 2 lbs . A Race Since August 25 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000 (Races Where Entered For $8,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TIZ THE REASON moved to the inside and rated the early pace, came under pressure past the five sixteenths pole, raced near the rail on the turn and held on under steady encouragement. FORTES gave chase, raced in the three path on the turn, finished well to take second later yards and was gaining on the winner. RUNNING FREE was jostled leaving the gate then gave chase outside, rounded the turn in the five path and finished well to take third the final yards. SPEAK YOUR MIND was bumped leaving the gate then gave chase, rounded the turn near the rail and flattened inside the sixteenth pole. MY LOVELY GIRL chased inside but lacked room approaching the quarter pole, angled to the three path into the turn then flattened stride leaving the turn. MIND YOUR OWN was bumped leaving the gate then gave chase, steadied approaching the quarter pole and showed little further. VALID REASON gave chase inside then faded at the rail on the turn. SIS BOOM BOB engaged in close chase through the backstretch, raced off the rail on the turn and weakened in the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: Running Free
ENTRY.COMMENT: jostled break,chased outside,5p turn,finished well,up 3rd late

ENTRY.NAME: Tiz the Reason
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,pressured 5/16,rail turn,held on driving

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 72. Claiming Purse 10800. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: WINDSOR'S TRACKER raced with the pace three wide through the front stretch then stalked on the opening turn, picked up the chase approaching the seven sixteenths pole, raced at a close disadvantage off the rail on the far turn but dug in under determined handling and took the nod under the wire. NIGHT TRAIN WAYNE raced with the pace inside through the front stretch then showed the way into the opening turn, came under pressure approaching the five sixteenths pole, contested the edge at the rail on the far turn, dug in under steady handling leaving the turn but missed the nod under the wire. FELICIAS CASTLE rounded the opening turn about the four path, started a bid past the seven sixteenths pole and steadily improved two deep on the far turn, but was outfinished in the duel through the stretch. SARGENT KOBE rounded the first turn in the three path, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced in the five path on the far turn and ran evenly in the stretch. RUN TO DAYLIGHT saved ground, picked up the chase toward the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn near the rail and flattened in the lane. SPECTACULO raced off the rail the first turn, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, came through the far turn about the three path and weakened in the stretch. RED DEVOLUTION raced with the pace two deep and between horses through the front stretch but faded at the rail leaving the five sixteenths pole. THUNDERINREADYRICK dwelt at the break and never factored.

ENTRY.NAME: Thunderinreadyrick
ENTRY.OWNER: Bass Tamera L Perry William M and Perry Susan D

ENTRY.NAME: Night Train Wayne
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace,pressured 5/16,edge rail turn,miss nod wire

ENTRY.NAME: Windsor's Tracker
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked,chased 7/16,close off rail turn,determined,nod under wire

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Law Legacy Stable, LLC. & Ronney Brown

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 42. Maiden Claiming Purse 16600. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 121 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, if for $10,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: WINDSOR'S MEMORY took the lead passing the seven sixteenths pole and set a pressured pace, contested the edge at the rail on the turn and held on well under steady stretch handling. UNALTERED pressured the pace and raced close two deep on the turn but was outfinished in the duel through the stretch. TAPTAP chased outside, rounded the turn about the seven path and finished evenly to take third the final strides. LIL SPITTIN IMAGE gave chase toward the inside, raced at the rail on the turn then flattened in the lane. RUMORGOINGAROUND chased, rounded the turn near the rail and ran evenly in the stretch. SWISS HORIZON gave chase toward mid track, raced in the four path on the turn and weakened. GANGSTER AMERICANO gave chase outside, raced in the six path on the turn and weakened. Mireya became fractious in the gate and was a late scratch.

ENTRY.NAME: Windsor's Memory
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,edge rail turn,held well driving

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 73. Claiming Purse 13700. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE APRIL 25, 2023 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Since April 25 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000 , if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: AMERICAN BOUND gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn in the two and three paths, dueled for the lead nearing mid-stretch and extended her lead the final sixteenth. MO CO GOLD gave chase, raced at the rail on the turn and dueled for second later yards. DING DING took a quick lead while tapering in and rated the pace, came under pressure leaving the five sixteenths pole and rounded the turn at the rail, was met mid-stretch and flattened stride. BESTLA chased through the backstretch, raced in the three path on the turn and ran evenly in the lane. SULTRY SALLY H chased outside, raced in the five path on the turn and flattened in the lane. TRIKKI NIKKI gave chase while saving ground. SUPER WILDCAT dropped well back early.

ENTRY.NAME: Ding Ding
ENTRY.OWNER: A and B Racing Stable LLC

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 75. Allowance Purse 27400. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING, RESTRICTED OR STATE BRED RACES OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners O f A Race Since September 25 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since August 25 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LUNATIC set a pressured pace outside, inched clear of Black Panda past the quarter pole and was steadily handled to hold on well. CEDAR'S WISH gave chase and raced close in the three path on the turn then dug in to take second later yards. TIMETOGETUP chased through the backstretch, raced in the four path on the turn then dueled through later yards for third. BLACK PANDA pressured the winner through the backstretch but dropped back at the rail past the quarter pole and flattened stride later yards. DORITA'S HEART angled to the outside and gave chase, rounded the turn in the three and four paths and weakened in the stretch. WHALE OF A TIME chased, rounded the turn at the rail and weakened.

ENTRY.NAME: dh-Dorita's Heart
ENTRY.OWNER: Two Ten Twelve Triple T Racing

ENTRY.NAME: Black Panda
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace,dropped back rail 1/4,flattened later yards

ENTRY.NAME: Lunatic
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,inched clear past 1/4,held well driving

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 49. Maiden Claiming Purse 10800. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 121 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HERECOMES SCARLETT was jostled leaving the gate and settled close off the rail on the first turn, bid leaving the three eighths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn, drifted leaving the turn then angled in past the eighth pole, took the lead in later yards and raced clear nearing the wire. LADY CAIRO exchanged contact with Herecomes Scarlett leaving the gate then took the lead and moved to the inside to rate the pace, came under pressure toward the five sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail but was met, and relented in later yards. GOLDEN BLOSSOM rated close inside on the first turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail, flattened inside the eighth pole and just lasted for third. RED RIVER SUSI saved ground, started a bid nearing the three eighths pole and raced at the rail on the far turn, eased to the outside of Golden Blossom into the lane, finished evenly and just missed third. MOONTAP rounded the first turn in the three path, gave chase leaving the three eighths pole, raced in the three path on the far turn, eased outward into the stretch and passed some rivals. HEY RIRI exchanged contact with Herecomes Scarlett leaving the gate and rounded the first turn in the four path, left the turn outside, picked up the chase toward the seven sixteenths pole, raced in the five path on the far turn and passed rivals in the lane. DEAREST M. A. saved ground on the first turn, gave chase from the three eighths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn and showed little in the lane. PRINCESS LEXI was reluctant to load, rounded the first turn in the four path and gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, raced in the four path on the far turn and weakened in the stretch. WAVERLEY showed little response through the backstretch. NO SHARING showed little response.

ENTRY.NAME: Red River Susi
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,bid 3/8,rail far turn,just missed 3rd,even finish

ENTRY.NAME: Dearest M. A.
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,chased 3/8,off rail turn,little in lane

ENTRY.NAME: Herecomes Scarlett
ENTRY.COMMENT: jostled break,off rail,bid 3/8,off rail turn,up late,clear wire

ENTRY.NAME: Hey Riri
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped break,4p 1st turn,chased 7/16,5p far turn,passed rivals
